Row.Text: Classical ranged infantry Unit. Ignores terrain costs. Only Mali can build it.

The Skirmisher is the unique Malian replacement for the Composite Bowman. Its ability to ignore terrain costs makes it flexible for both offense and defense, able to move and shoot in the same turn even in rough terrain. Use them for suprise volleys against vulnerable enemy units, or bait enemies into chasing you through rough terrain while you rain shots from one step father each turn.

At its height, the Mali Empire stretched halfway across Africa, and included many subordinate tribes. To keep order, the Mali employed a huge standing army. During war, the Mali often fought as "skirmishers" - soldiers who fan out in loose formation to protect the main force's flanks or front. The Mali skirmishers were lightly-armed archers in that force, famed for their courage and their marksmanship.
